good one
```{r}
library("circlize")
library("ComplexHeatmap")
library("dendsort")

# Cluster-Dendrogramm f√ºr die Zeilen (Bakterien)
row_dend <- dendsort(hclust(dist(genome33)))

# Farbskala f√ºr die Heatmap
f2 <- colorRamp2(seq(min(genome33), max(genome33), length = 3), c("blue", "#EEEEEE", "red"), space = "RGB")

# Erstelle die zweigeteilte Heatmap
h3 <- Heatmap(genome33, 
        name = "Coefficient", # Titel der Legende
        col = f2,
        cluster_rows = row_dend, 
        cluster_columns = FALSE,
        row_order = sort(rownames(genome33)),
        column_split = column_grouping,  # üî• Hier wird die Heatmap in 2 Bereiche geteilt!
        column_title = c("Food Groups", "Nutrients"), # √úberschriften f√ºr die Bereiche
        row_title = "Genus",
        row_names_gp = gpar(fontsize = 8), # Schriftgr√∂√üe f√ºr Zeilennamen
        column_names_gp = gpar(fontsize = 8), # Schriftgr√∂√üe f√ºr Spaltennamen
        show_column_dend = FALSE,
        column_names_rot = -45,
        width = unit(10, "cm"), height = unit(18, "cm"),
        row_names_max_width = max_text_width(rownames(genome33), gp = gpar(fontsize = 10)),
        
        # F√ºge Sternchen f√ºr p-Werte < 0.25 hinzu
        cell_fun = function(j, i, x, y, w, h, fill) {
	               if(p.genome33[i, j] < 0.25) {
		               grid.text("*", x, y)
	               }
        })

# Heatmap anzeigen
h3


#ggsave("heatmap.f1.png")
```
